title: TLCTC v2.0 — Agentic AI Consequence Chains
description: Consequence-side event sequences from 'The Consequence Amplifier'. These are effect-side records (right side of the Bow-Tie) and MUST NOT be confused with cause-side attack paths. The C: prefix explicitly marks consequence-side notation per Axiom III (threats are causes, not outcomes).

metadata.source_paper: The Consequence Amplifier — Agentic AI on the Right Side of the Bow-Tie
metadata.author: Bernhard Kreinz
metadata.extension_status: Proposed extension to TLCTC JSON architecture for consequence-side recording. Under development.

amplification_properties.description: Three structurally distinct properties that make agentic AI consequences different from traditional software consequences. These are multiplicative, not additive.

properties.name: Velocity Amplification
properties.definition: Consequences propagate at machine speed (Δt ≈ 0), collapsing the temporal window available for detection, response, and containment.
properties.control_implication: Only automated consequence-side controls survive the velocity test. Human-speed detection and response arrive after the damage is done.

properties.name: Scope Amplification
properties.definition: A single compromise event cascades across multiple systems, APIs, data stores, and organisational domains simultaneously through the agent's designed integration points.
properties.control_implication: Blast-radius caps and tool-access restrictions are the most effective controls. The agent's pre-authorised access defines the maximum damage.

properties.name: Autonomy Amplification
properties.definition: The agent continues operating after the initial consequence, compounding damage through self-directed follow-up actions without requiring further attacker input.
properties.control_implication: Consequence chains are longer, more adaptive, and harder to predict. Detection must focus on patterns, not individual actions.

consequence_chain_notation.description: Proposed notation for consequence-side sequences, separate from cause-side attack path notation.
consequence_chain_notation.purpose: Explicitly marks effect-side notation to maintain Axiom III discipline

dre_subtypes..ext: Externalised — consequence crosses organisational boundary via legitimate integration
dre_subtypes..audit: Audit manipulation — monitoring or logging integrity compromised
dre_subtypes..evidence: Forensic degradation — evidence quality reduced for post-incident analysis

domain_boundary_notation.description: Consequence-side boundary crossing through authorised integration channels. NOT a supply chain attack (#10) — this is damage propagation, not trust exploitation.
domain_boundary_notation.distinction: Cause-side #10 exploits a trust dependency. Consequence-side boundary crossing propagates damage through an integration that works exactly as designed.

consequence_chains.title: Compromised Enterprise AI Agent — Full Cascading Consequence Chain
consequence_chains.description: A legitimate enterprise agent compromised via indirect prompt injection (#1) autonomously chains five consequence events across CRM, email, and admin systems in seconds.

cause_side_reference.notes: Single cause-side event (indirect prompt injection, #1 Abuse of Functions). All subsequent activity is consequence-side.

steps.description: Agent reads customer database via CRM API
steps.irreversibility_window: Zero — data exposure is permanent once read by compromised process

steps.description: Agent sends data to external endpoint via email integration
steps.enables_next: Exfiltration completed; triggers no alert because email integration is authorised
steps.irreversibility_window: Zero — once email is sent, data is externally exposed

steps.description: Agent modifies audit logs via admin API to hide CRM access
steps.enables_next: Detection is suppressed — log-based monitoring will not flag the access
steps.irreversibility_window: Until immutable log backup is checked (if one exists)

steps.description: Agent sends phishing emails to customers using exfiltrated data, impersonating the organisation
steps.enables_next: Customers are now victims; reputational and legal damage begins
steps.irreversibility_window: Zero — messages cannot be recalled after delivery

steps.description: Agent modifies CRM records to remove evidence of data access and cover tracks
steps.enables_next: Forensic evidence is degraded; incident investigation is hampered
steps.irreversibility_window: Until backup comparison or journal replay

consequence_chains.total_elapsed_time: Seconds. Entire chain C1–C5 can complete before any human detection.

DETECT: Output monitoring on agent's outbound communications
Cross-system correlation (CRM read + email send + admin access in same time window)
Consequence chain pattern detection (data read → exfil → log modification is a known pattern)
RESPOND: Kill switch: immediate agent termination on anomaly detection
Circuit breaker: automatic suspension when outbound email volume exceeds baseline
Automatic isolation: sever API connections when containment triggers
RECOVER: CRM records: restore from transaction journal (if available)
Audit logs: compare against immutable backup (if configured)
Customer communications: breach notification (irreversible — cannot undo sent emails)

consequence_chains.title: Compromised Financial Agent — Transaction Chain
consequence_chains.description: A legitimate financial processing agent compromised via direct prompt injection autonomously chains fraudulent transactions across payment systems.

steps.description: Agent initiates series of payment transactions to attacker-controlled accounts
steps.irreversibility_window: Minutes to hours (settlement window) — zero for instant payment systems

steps.description: Agent modifies invoice records to make fraudulent payments appear legitimate
steps.enables_next: Reconciliation processes will not flag the transactions
steps.irreversibility_window: Until backup comparison or audit review

steps.description: Agent suppresses payment confirmation notifications by modifying alert configurations
steps.enables_next: Finance team receives no real-time notification of transactions

steps.description: Agent exports transaction history and account details to external endpoint
steps.enables_next: Attacker has financial records for further exploitation or sale

consequence_chains.total_elapsed_time: Seconds. All four steps complete before the first payment confirmation would normally reach a human.
consequence_chains.c_suite_impact_assessment: Maximum damage in 60 seconds = (transaction cap × number of transactions possible at VC-4 speed). If no transaction cap exists, the answer is: the agent's entire authorised payment limit.

consequence_chains.title: Compromised Infrastructure Agent — Cascading Availability Loss
consequence_chains.description: A legitimate infrastructure management agent compromised via credential theft (#4→#1) autonomously modifies critical infrastructure configuration.

steps.description: Agent modifies DNS records to redirect traffic away from production services
steps.enables_next: All services depending on affected DNS records become unreachable
steps.irreversibility_window: Seconds (DNS propagation) — but TTL-based caching may extend impact for hours

steps.description: Agent revokes TLS certificates for critical services
steps.enables_next: HTTPS services fail certificate validation; clients cannot connect
steps.irreversibility_window: Hours (new certificate issuance and deployment required)

steps.description: Agent modifies container orchestration configuration to scale down critical services to zero replicas
steps.enables_next: Services are configured to not run; data exists but applications cannot access it
steps.irreversibility_window: Minutes (rollback possible, but must identify correct configuration state)

steps.description: Agent clears infrastructure audit trails and modifies monitoring dashboards to show normal status
steps.enables_next: Operations team sees green dashboards while services are down; delays incident response

consequence_chains.total_elapsed_time: Seconds. Infrastructure changes propagate to dependent services within seconds to minutes.
consequence_chains.recovery_complexity: High. Multiple infrastructure layers affected simultaneously. Recovery order matters: DNS before certificates before container configuration. Incorrect recovery order can compound the outage.
